intro: Nototriche clandestina, commonly known as the hidden nototriche, is a rare and elusive flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. Its growth is slow and it thrives in well-drained soils with minimal water. Due to its rarity and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
